intro: Dobrowskya serratifolia, commonly known as the serrated leaf daisies, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, serrated leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its delicate appearance. Dobrowskya serratifolia prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or coastal areas.
